title: Gunter Grass - Nobel Prize in Literature, 1999 (16 books)
description:
* * This is an revised and enlarged version of an earlier torrent * *


GÃƒÅ“NTER GRASS (b. 1927) is a German novelist, poet, and playwright, who is widely regarded as Germany's most famous living writer. When he was awarded the 1999 Nobel Prize in Literature, the Swedish Academy noted him as a writer "whose frolicsome black fables portray the forgotten face of history."

He is best known among English-language readers for his "Danzig Trilogy", a series of novels that focus on the interwar and wartime period in the Free City of Danzig (now GdaÃ…â€žsk, Poland): THE TIN DRUM (in two translations), acclaimed as the greatest German novel written since the end of World War II, is the autobiography of thirty-year-old Oskar Matzerath, who has lived through the long Nazi nightmare and who, as the novel begins, is being held in a mental institution; CAT AND MOUSE, centered on the narrator's vivid recollection of a boyhood scene during World War II; and DOG YEARS, a novel in three parts, beginning in the 1920s and ending in the 1950s, that follows the lives of two friends from the prewar years in Germany through an apocalyptic period and its startling aftermath.


This collection features 11 novels, as well as plays, poetry, and essays, which are in PDF format unless otherwise indicated below:

* THE CALL OF THE TOAD (Harcourt, Brace & Co, 1992). Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* CAT AND MOUSE (Harcourt, Brace & World, 1963). Translated by Ralph Manheim. -- ePUB + PDF

* CRABWALK (Harcourt, 2002).  Translated by Krishna Winston.

* DOG YEARS (Harcourt, Brace & World, 1965). Translated by Ralph Manheim. -- PDF + ePUB

* FOUR PLAYS: Flood / Mister, Mister / Only Ten Minutes to Buffalo / The Wicked Cooks (Harcourt, Brace & World, 1967).  Introduction by Martin Esslin.

* FROM THE DIARY OF A SNAIL (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, 1973).  Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* LOCAL ANAESTHETIC (Harcourt, Brace & World, 1970). Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* THE MEETING AT TELGTE (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, 1981).  Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* MY CENTURY (Harcourt, 1999).  Translated by Michael Henry Heim.

* NOVEMBERLAND: Selected Poems, 1956-1993 (Harcourt, Brace & Co, 1996). Translated by Michael Hamburger.

* THE RAT (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, 1987).  Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* SHOW YOUR TONGUE (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, 1981).  Translated by John E. Woods.

* THE TIN DRUM (Vintage, 1990).  Translated by Ralph Manheim.

* THE TIN DRUM (Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, 2009). Translated by Breon Mitchell. -- ePUB

* TOO FAR AFIELD (Harcourt, 2000).  Translated by Krishna Winston.

* TWO STATES - ONE NATION (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, 1990).  Translated by Krishna Winston and A. S. Wensinger
